class_description: Operating and loading conditions that drive thermal fatigue in metallic components, including cyclic stresses arising from temperature changes and repeated thermal cycling.
evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature... particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

member_entities.entity_description: Repeatedly varying mechanical stresses that arise due to changing temperatures in components.
member_entities.resolution_context: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature. These cyclic stresses contribute to cracking in metallic components where movement or expansion is constrained.

member_entities.entity_description: Changes in temperature over time that induce cyclic stresses in metallic components.
member_entities.resolution_context: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature. These temperature variations lead to repeated expansion and contraction, especially under repeated thermal cycling.

member_entities.entity_description: Repeated heating and cooling cycles that subject components to alternating thermal stresses.
member_entities.resolution_context: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

class_description: Physical phenomena involving constrained mechanical or thermal deformation between regions or parts of a component (such as relative movement or differential expansion) that can lead to cracking, especially under repeated thermal cycling.
evidence_excerpt: Cracking may occur where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

member_entities.entity_description: Mechanical motion between different parts or regions of a component that may be constrained.
member_entities.resolution_context: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

member_entities.entity_description: Non-uniform thermal expansion between different regions of a component that can be constrained.
member_entities.resolution_context: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

class_description: Damage mechanism in metallic components caused by cyclic thermal stresses leading to cracking under constrained conditions.
evidence_excerpt: Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperatureâ€¦ damage is in the form of cracking.

member_entities.entity_description: Damage mechanism in metals caused by cyclic thermal stresses leading to cracking under constrained conditions.
member_entities.resolution_context:
4.2.9 Thermal Fatigue
4.2.9.1 Description of Damage
Thermal fatigue is the result of cyclic stresses caused by variations in temperature. Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

class_description: Fracture-type damage in metallic components caused by constrained differential expansion under repeated thermal cycling.
evidence_excerpt: Fracture-type damage forming in metallic components as a manifestation of thermal fatigue.

member_entities.entity_description: Fracture-type damage forming in metallic components as a manifestation of thermal fatigue.
member_entities.resolution_context: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.

class_description: Metal structural or mechanical part that can experience constrained movement or differential expansion, making it susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking under repeated thermal cycling.
evidence_excerpt: Any metal structural or mechanical part susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained.

member_entities.entity_description: Any metal structural or mechanical part susceptible to thermal fatigue cracking.
member_entities.resolution_context: Damage is in the form of cracking that may occur anywhere in a metallic component where relative movement or differential expansion is constrained, particularly under repeated thermal cycling.
